title: Foundation: A/Ls and IT Basics
description: A G.C.E. A/L in the Maths or Technology stream is beneficial. Develop a strong understanding of basic computer hardware, operating systems, and the fundamentals of how the internet works.

title: Core Networking Education & Certification
description: Pursue a diploma or degree in IT or computer networks. Crucially, obtain foundational industry certifications like CompTIA Network+ and Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), which are highly valued by employers.

title: Junior Network Administrator / Engineer
description: Work in an entry-level role, often in a Network Operations Center (NOC). You'll be responsible for monitoring network performance, troubleshooting issues, and performing basic configuration of routers and switches.

title: Network Engineer
description: As a Network Engineer, you will design, implement, and manage network infrastructure. This involves more complex tasks, including planning network layouts, upgrading hardware, and implementing security policies.

title: Senior Network Engineer / Network Architect
description: Advance to a senior position where you are responsible for the high-level design of the entire network architecture. This role requires deep technical expertise, strategic thinking, and the ability to align network strategy with business goals. Specializations in cloud networking or security are common.
qualifications: CCIE (Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert) - Optional but prestigious
